item.title: 澳大利亚社交媒体禁令将允许一些年龄检查错误
item.description: 澳大利亚即将发布针对 16 岁以下青少年的社交媒体禁令，这将给 Facebook、TikTok 和其他平台在检查用户年龄时留出犯错的余地，将部分控制权交给了法律试图约束的公司，同时也为儿童规避规则创造了空间。【原文：Australia’s looming social media ban for under-16s will give Facebook, TikTok and other platforms leeway to make mistakes when checking a user’s age, handing some control to the companies that the law is trying to rein in, and creating scope for children to avoid the rules.】

item.title: 中国企业抢滩香港市场，香港股权交易蓬勃发展
item.description: 随着中国企业巨头急于筹集资金，香港银行家们完成了数十亿美元的资本市场交易，一举结束了夏季的沉寂。【原文：Hong Kong bankers have ended the summer lull with a bang, closing billions of dollars of capital market deals as China’s corporate giants rush to raise cash.】

item.title: 美联储降息预期升温，黄金稳定在历史纪录附近
item.description: 由于投资者押注美联储本周降息，并权衡未来几个月更多货币宽松政策的空间，黄金保持涨势，创下新纪录。【原文：Gold held a gain that saw it reach a fresh record, as investors bet on a Federal Reserve rate cut this week and weighed the scope for more monetary easing in coming months.】

item.title: 红杉亚洲分拆公司押注人工智能创业公司打击网络假货
item.description: 红杉资本（Sequoia Capital）的前亚洲分支正在投资一家鲜为人知的初创公司，该公司负责查处未经授权的人工智能芯片、药品、游戏和奢侈品销售清单。【原文：Sequoia Capital’s former Asian arms are investing in a little-known startup that hunts and helps take down unauthorized sales listings of AI chips, drugs, games and luxury products.】

item.title: 日本央行将按兵不动，石破茂的退出为加息路径增添阴云
item.description: 日本首相石破茂最近宣布辞职后，日本央行本周可能将维持基准利率不变。【原文：The Bank of Japan will likely leave its benchmark interest rate untouched this week after Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba’s recent resignation announcement added to the list of uncertainties to consider.】

item.title: 日本股市连续第四天上涨，科技股上涨
item.description: 周一东京股市休市时，美股表现稳健，尤其是半导体和科技股表现强劲，受此提振，日本股市连续第四天上涨。【原文：Japanese stocks rose for a fourth day, buoyed by the solid performance of US shares when the Tokyo market was closed Monday, particularly in semiconductor and technology stocks.】

item.title: 美国将于周二对日本汽车出口征收 15%的关税
item.description: 据特朗普政府称，美国将根据两国之间的贸易协议，从周二上午开始正式对从日本进口的汽车和汽车零部件实施较低的 15%关税税率。【原文：The US will begin formally implementing a lower 15% tariff rate on imports of automobiles and auto parts from Japan as of Tuesday morning, according to the Trump administration, in line with a trade deal between the two economies.】

item.title: 印度 2025 年液化天然气需求下降，买家等待供应浪潮到来
item.description: 印度的液化天然气年需求量将在2025年出现多年来的首次萎缩，原因是买家对产量激增持观望态度，而产量激增有望推低价格。【原文：India’s annual liquefied natural gas demand is set to contract in 2025 for the first time in years, as buyers hold out for a surge in production that is expected to push down prices.】

item.title: 随着灰色市场预示着 60% 的溢价，Urban 将在印度火热登场
item.description: 根据灰色市场的迹象，Urban Company Ltd. 首次公开发行的 2.15 亿美元股票将于周三强劲上市，这是印度今年认购最多的股票。【原文：Urban Company Ltd.’s $215 million initial public offering, the most subscribed in India this year, is poised for a strong trading debut on Wednesday, according to indications in the gray market.】

item.title: 美联储新一轮宽松周期来临之际，国债跑赢全球同行
item.description: 由于美联储新一轮降息的前景推翻了人们对美国债务的普遍看空观点，国债在今年的主要主权债券市场中一举跃居首位。【原文：Treasuries have powered into first place among major sovereign bond markets this year as the prospect of a new round of Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts overturns widely held bearish views on US debt.】

item.title: 中国煤炭价格低廉导致难以减少消费
item.description: 在中国政府实现气候目标的关键一年到来之前，中国的煤炭价格将在 2025 年以 "呜咽 "而非 "砰然 "的声音结束。【原文：Chinese coal prices are on course to close out 2025 with a whimper rather than a bang, ahead of a critical year in the government’s mission to meet its climate targets.】

item.title: 关注俄罗斯进一步制裁和供应过剩，石油保持涨势
item.description: 由于投资者权衡西方对俄罗斯供应进一步制裁的可能性和即将出现的供应过剩，石油在连续两天上涨后趋于稳定。【原文：Oil steadied after two days of gains as investors weigh the potential of further western sanctions on Russian supplies against a looming glut.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会与温克艾沃斯的双子座公司将解决加密借贷诉讼案
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会（US Securities and Exchange Commission）和双子座信托公司（Gemini Trust Co.【原文：The US Securities and Exchange Commission and Gemini Trust Co. are close to resolving the agency’s lawsuit claiming the firm illegally raised billions of dollars through an unregistered lending crypto program, attorneys said in a court filing.】

item.title: 去年出价创下新高后激进基金加码日本市场
item.description: 激进投资者正在加速购买日本股票，在去年创下的记录基础上再接再厉，因为治理改革和股东友好型转变使日本成为投资者倡导的最热门市场之一。【原文：Activist investors are accelerating purchases of Japanese stocks, building on last year’s record, as governance reforms and shareholder-friendly shifts make the country one of the hottest markets for investor advocacy.】

item.title: 阿波罗称银行合作对高级私人信贷至关重要
item.description: 阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management Inc.总裁吉姆-泽尔特（Jim Zelter）认为。【原文：Private credit’s effort to finance investment-grade companies is going to come down to its partnerships with banks, according to Apollo Global Management Inc. President Jim Zelter.】

item.title: 美银美林策略师称中国股市狂飙难再现
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp. ）的一位期权策略师称，中国股市目前的涨势不太可能与近期的亢奋情绪相提并论。【原文：The current rally in Chinese stocks is unlikely to match recent bouts of euphoria, according to a Bank of America Corp. options strategist who correctly called gains in the market previously.】

item.title: 亚洲期货市场在美联储会议前表现谨慎乐观市场综述
item.description: 随着华尔街在美联储本周预期降息前创下新高，亚洲股市开盘将以积极为主。【原文：Asian stocks are poised for a mainly positive open as Wall Street hit fresh highs ahead of an expected Federal Reserve rate cut this week.】

item.title: 澳大利亚市场警察称澳新银行必须避免 "黑暗日子 "重演
item.description: 澳大利亚最高证券监管机构称，澳新银行周一同意支付创纪录的罚款后，该行新任行长努诺-马托斯（Nuno Matos）仍有许多工作要做，以确保过去的不当行为不再发生。【原文：Australia’s top securities regulator said ANZ Group Holdings Ltd.’s new chief Nuno Matos still has a lot of work to do to ensure that past misconduct doesn’t reoccur, after the bank agreed to pay a record fine on Monday.】

item.title: 亚马逊预计到 2026 年初 Kuiper 将为五个国家提供服务
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）的一位高管表示，该公司的卫星互联网合资企业的目标是到 2026 年第一季度末能够向美国、加拿大、法国、德国和英国提供服务。【原文：Amazon.com Inc.’s satellite internet venture aims to be able to offer service to the US, Canada, France, Germany and the UK by the end of the first quarter of 2026, an executive said.】

item.title: 颠覆美国生育产业的人力成本
item.description:
对美国发展最快的试管婴儿连锁店之一的临床失误、人员危机和财务压力的调查。【原文：

An investigation into clinical mistakes, staffing crises, and financial pressures at one of America's fastest-growing IVF chains.

】

item.title: Plaid 因客户数据纠纷向摩根大通支付费用
item.description: Plaid Inc.同意向摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：Plaid Inc. agreed to pay JPMorgan Chase & Co. for its consumer data, the latest accord in a battle between financial technology firms and banks over who can access the sought-after information.】

item.title: 对冲基金就日元掉期清算所问题在美国商品期货交易委员会获胜
item.description: 在华尔街最高监管机构表示将允许一家日本公司为美国客户清算日元利率掉期之后，对冲基金在华盛顿取得了一场胜利。【原文：Hedge funds secured a victory in Washington after a top Wall Street regulator said it would let a Japanese firm clear yen interest rates swaps for US customers.】

item.title: 共同基金巨头大举进军私募市场。没有奏效
item.description:
资产管理公司向另类投资扩张，以获取更高的费用。一些公司最终面临文化冲突和销售人员的低迷。【原文：

Asset managers expanded into alternative investments for higher fees. Some ended up facing culture clashes and sluggish pickup from salespeople.

】

item.title: 委内瑞拉与竞标者在法院拍卖中就 Citgo 的价值发生冲突
item.description: 周一，委内瑞拉代表和委内瑞拉最有价值外国资产的竞标者在美国法院发生冲突，特拉华州的一名法官开始了为期三天的出售听证会，以决定谁将接管 Citgo 石油公司的母公司。【原文：Venezuelan representatives and bidders for its most valuable foreign asset are clashing in a US court on Monday, as a judge in Delaware starts a three-day sale hearing to decide who will take over the parent of Citgo Petroleum Corp.】

item.title: 负价格持续，西得克萨斯天然气跌至 14 个月低点
item.description: 西得克萨斯州的天然气现货价格最近几天跌破零点，降至近 14 个月以来的最低点，因为交易商预计该地区的管道维修将在一段时间内抑制燃料的流动。【原文：Natural gas cash prices in West Texas, which dipped below zero in recent days, sank to the lowest in almost 14 months, as traders expect pipeline maintenance in the area to stifle movement of the fuel for some time.】

item.title: CMBS 先驱彭纳发起竞选加州州长的长期角逐
item.description: 曾帮助改变商业地产融资方式的交易员伊桑-彭纳（Ethan Penner），发起了一场旷日持久的独立竞选，希望成为下一任加州州长。【原文：Ethan Penner, a trader who helped transform the way commercial properties are financed, launched a long-shot independent bid to become California’s next governor.】

item.title: CFTC 命令加密货币贷款公司 Voyager 前首席执行官支付 75 万美元
item.description: 美国商品期货交易委员会（Commodity Futures Trading Commission）周一表示，破产的加密货币贷款公司 Voyager Digital Ltd. 的联合创始人和前负责人必须向被抛弃的 Voyager 客户支付 75 万美元。【原文：The co-founder and former head of bankrupt crypto lender Voyager Digital Ltd. must pay $750,000 to jilted Voyager customers, the Commodity Futures Trading Commission said Monday.】

item.title: 墨西哥商会称墨西哥关税计划阻碍中国投资
item.description: 墨西哥中国商会警告说，墨西哥计划对来自中国的产品加征关税，这将阻止中国在墨西哥的投资。【原文：Mexico’s planned tariff hikes on products from China will halt Chinese investments in the country, warned the Mexico-China Chamber of Commerce.】

item.title: StubHub IPO 让直销门票计划成为焦点
item.description: StubHub Holdings Inc. 希望在首次公开募股之前，通过扩大体育和其他现场活动新门票销售业务的计划来刺激投资者。【原文：StubHub Holdings Inc. is hoping to excite investors ahead of its initial public offering with its plan to expand its business selling new tickets for sports and other live events.】

item.title: 网络卡通股价因迪士尼投资和在线漫画风险投资而飙升
item.description: 华特迪士尼公司（Walt Disney Co.）将与网络卡通娱乐公司（Webtoon Entertainment Inc.【原文：Walt Disney Co. is bringing all of its marquee comics to a new digital platform and app in partnership with Webtoon Entertainment Inc., sending shares of the upstart company soaring.】
